intro: Mapouria burchelliana, commonly known as the white mapouria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, oval-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. The flowers bloom in clusters and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
